name: St. Innocent of Alaska

locations.description: Bishop and missionary in Alaska, later Metropolitan of Moscow

summary: Innocent of Alaska was a Russian Orthodox bishop and missionary who worked extensively in Alaska, translating the Bible and liturgical texts into Aleut and other native languages. He later became Metropolitan of Moscow. He was a skilled linguist, ethnographer, and educator who deeply respected the cultures of the peoples he served. He is considered an apostle to Alaska and the Americas.
